data.title: Into the Woods Presentation
data.text: The cast, music and show itself was hugely entertaining!  Although this performance has been put to bed, I have found the intimate setting at the Muncie Civic Theater just right to feel involved in the life of the shows.

data.title: Great EXPECTATIONS - Success
data.text: We've attended plays here before, & on this occasion our granddaughter was in one.  The theater, itself, restored & beautiful in its origional architectural grandeur, is enhanced by plays of all types. It's an enjoyable to spend time it this theatrical experience. The local talent, acting, productions & directors, amaze us.  The snacks are reasonably priced. We're anxious to return for another performance.

data.title: Beautiful interior
data.text: Excellent productions.  Use of local University theater majors make all productions spectacular.  Love the vintage vibe of the building.  Well run by the not-for-profit board.

data.title: Out of the way jewel
data.text:
This little theater has lots of local people you never knew
that had talent. Muncie has lots of singers & dancers who
can keep you laughing or they can make you cry. You need to give them a try. Inexpancive  fun for all

data.title: great community theater
data.text: this is a local theater and its mostly the community involved with the shows. Some university students come 'over' and be in plays also. they are current with a lot of shows. its homey theater, been a theater for years, and is registered as a national treasure. IT has won numerous awards both state, national and even international competitions. Go and just have a good time.

data.title: Great play
data.text: THE TOYMAKER was on stage this past Saturday to Muncie Civic Theater.  The format was very unusual and very enjoyable.  I always enjoy an evening at Muncie Civic.

data.title: Muncie Gem
data.text:
Muncie Civic provides a tremendous atmosphere for our local actors/singers/directors as well as pulling some students from Ball State for year round productions. The Historic Building has been restored in many areas, and is beautifully maintained with great oak features.  More is needed to be done, like seats need to be replaced (but that takes $$$).

We recently saw My Son Picciochio and it was WONDERFUL show.  The actors and kids did an unbelievable job.   We took our grand daughters and they loved the show.

data.title: "Cabaret" was very well done
data.text: We saw the musical Cabaret, and enjoyed the music, the singing, the acting, the sets, costumes very much.  The old theater has a great ambience.

data.title: Landmark theater
data.text:
Muncie Civic Theatre is a downtown landmark. It isn't a fancy venue. You can expect a small theatre with balcony, showing signs of its age, but with productions of excellent quality. 

Last night we went to see Cabaret. The cast included experienced Civic performers, as well as young talent from the theater department at Ball State University. This is typical of other Civic performances I have attended.

As a hearing-impaired person, I appreciate the fact that new speakers have been installed that allow me to catch all the dialogue. The music between acts was a too loud for conversation, but we were in the front row, directly in front of the speakers. 

The staff are all very friendly and welcoming. Student discounts are available.

data.title: For a "local" theatre experience... this is a great place to enjoy!
data.text:
The Muncie Civic Theatre is a great place to experience local talent and spend an evening enlightening ones mind whilst supporting local actors, their dreams and the arts. Is it Broadway? Is it Professional? Even Local "for-profit"? No. But, it IS an outlet for local people to explore the arts... they try hard and they make up for lack of grants, money and funds.

Some.... much wealthier theatres have had poorer productions that I have seen. I have seen first hand that hard work and innovative creative minds have led to very well done productions in this community. Bravo and well done. However, many renovations and technical issues could be resolved. Still for an affordable live show this is a must when living or traveling in Muncie.

data.title: Civic showcases local talent
data.text: Muncie Civic Theater provides a great value with fine entertainment featuring local actors/singers/directors year round in a historic building.  Restoration has been done in several areas in the building (and more is needed) but the last few years have shown an upsurge in the quality of the shows, the appearance of the building, and the excitement in the community.  It is truly a place where family entertainment is prevalent (but more edgy material is also staged).

data.title: Historic building, good shows
data.text: Pulling a local talent base and students from area universities like Ball State, the shows are pretty good.  They are not all broadway quality, but I have seen some stellar performances.  If you're debating about attending a show - go ahead and give it a try.  For the price, you'll enjoy the experience.

data.title: Rick
data.text: I have been to many shows at Civic Theater and I have enjoyed every one of the shows.  The arts in Muncie, IN are great and I would take a date, family, or friends.  A great way to show your support in the community as well as see a great show.

data.title: Horrible Experince
data.text: Very old Building, lacking in accomadations for the eldery and handicapped. Not comfortable seating either.

data.title: Always a great time!
data.text: Recommended! This is something that you will never regret

data.title: The Producers Extrodinaire!
data.text: Old theater that has a following in a middle America town.  You'll love the decor and the people.  Ball State University students as well as local citizens perform drama, plays, and musicals.  Well worth season tickets.  Come and enjoy!

data.title: Great Plays
data.text: Well worth the price of a ticket to see a production here. Performances has always been top notch.

data.title: Had a wonderful time at the Blue's Clues show!
data.text:
My little girls had a blast at the Blue's Clues show. It was a cute performance put on by children and adults. They got to draw the three clues in the note books we brought and felt like they were a part of the show. 

The architecture in the theatre is absolutely beautiful. The seats are a little small as it's an older theatre, but the overall experience was fun.

data.title: ein super ort um die geschichte zu erfahren
data.text:
die lage auf unserer rundrteisen route hat uns ausnahmsweise hierher geführt. die führer dieser geführten tour im inneren waren sehr ambitioniert, wir konnten sogar viele fragen stellen.

bis auf die wenigen wechselnden ausstellungen gibts aber fast jeden abend weine vorstellung, die live besucht am besten einen eindruck vermittelt.

aich die angrenzenden lokale laden ein, sich kurzweilig zu beschäftigen.

klasse, um mal einen tag tot zu schlagen!
